title: Unseen Audrey: Unpublished pictures of an icon and the recollections of those who took them
text:
Stars don’t come much more perfectly formed, or perfectly talented, than Audrey Hepburn. Gamine, elegant and stylish, the Belgium-born actor, who died 26 years ago, is as adored today as she was in her lifetime.

Hepburn’s charms made her irresistible to photographers, and big names queued up to take her picture. Featured here are portraits by five of them. The images, included in the new book Always Audrey and chosen by photographic historian and curator Terence Pepper, have never been published before; those by Terry O’Neill and Eva Sereny are unseen. Whether taken on set, in a studio or at her Italian villa, they confirm why Hepburn’s image has had a grip on us ever since.

Douglas Kirkland...
